ResourceHeader.ResourceName: TIMED SEE Data from U. Colorado via ftp
ResourceHeader.Description: Several TIMED SEE (Solar Extreme Ultraviolet Experiment) data types are available from U. Colorado via ftp, mostly in netCDF. Level 3A data are also available via CDAWeb. The basic data are full-solar-disk spectra in the 0.1-194 nm wavelength range. The spectral resolution of the measurements is 0.4 nm above 25 nm and about 7 nm below 25 nm. Level 3A data files contain ~3-minute averaged solar spectral irradiance spectrum in three forms: (1) spectra from 0-194 nm in 1-nm intervals, (2) 38 emission lines (with background removed) extracted from EGS (EUV Grating Spectrograph) Level 2A spectra, and (3) XPS (X-Ray Photometer System) Level 2A results.

AccessURL.Name: PI ftp site at U. Colorado
In CDF via ftp from CDAWeb

TimeSpan.Note: Data are current to within a month.
